AD_Jahiera.synopsis: Part of Jaheira behaviour during Siege in the basement. Walks among the harpers and cheers them during battle. Martial. in command. Powerful.
AD_Jahiera.how_to_trigger: Start Siege in Haven (for example, kill Isobel). Go to the basement and wait Jaheira's AD

PAD_TentacleAppeared.synopsis: SCL Haven: Isobel is kidnapped/killed and shadows engulf the inn, combat starts against the shadows. At some point a huge tentacle emerges from the fountain in the middle of the yard, destroying the fountain. Player character has a PAD comment on the event.
PAD_TentacleAppeared.how_to_trigger: Enter Haven (Last Light). Use debug book command "Set quest flags" -> Act2 -> Haven -> Siege -> Start Siege right awayOREnter Haven, go to Isobel room, kill Isobel (can kill marcus too).Fight through the Siege

Outro.synopsis: After the battle against the shadows is over, we speak with Jaheira again. Either she hates us because she knows we killed Isobel, or she's contemplative in the aftermath of the battle, and we can have her join our camp.
Outro.how_to_trigger: - oe hav_siege_outro- Player get teleported into the Inn- Wait for a moment until Player is teleported to the battle and    the battle ends- Scene will happen after that

Intro.synopsis: Huge cinematic showing start of the Shadow Siege. Jaheira assesses the situation with the players, urgently, as darkness takes over the inn. Then a legion of shadows tear the guards apart as everyone else flees, and the party emerges to fight.
Intro.how_to_trigger: Isobel is kidnapped, killed, or otherwise forcibly removed from Last Light, dispelling the protection around the inn.

automatic_ordering.reasoning: The cinematic introductory scene (Intro) sets the stage for the Shadow Siege and must be seen first before any battle events occur. During the siege, two session events take place: one in which Jaheira is seen in the basement (AD_Jahiera) and another in which a huge tentacle appears as part of the battle (PAD_TentacleAppeared). Although both occur as part of the siege, there is no strict order between these two events since they represent parallel moments during the battle. Finally, the Outro scene occurs after the siege and, therefore, after the events of both AD_Jahiera and PAD_TentacleAppeared. There are no sessions that appear to be mutually exclusive based on their triggers and narrative descriptions.

AD_Jahiera_0.speaker: Jaheira
AD_Jahiera_0.text: Strike like lightning! Roar like thunder! Wash over them with a blizzard's fury!

PAD_TentacleAppeared_0.speaker: Player
PAD_TentacleAppeared_0.text: What in the hells is that?
PAD_TentacleAppeared_0.context: NodeContext: a giant tentacle has sprung up out of a fountain in the middle of a fight. Shock and perhaps a little furstration as player now has to fight it.

Outro_9.context: InternalNodeContext: Player and Jaheira gather in Haven yard after combat.

Outro_7.speaker: Jaheira
Outro_7.text: It's all over. They're all gone. My brave ones, my friends, my Harpers.

Outro_50.speaker: Jaheira
Outro_50.text: I led them here - to this.
Outro_50.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) On ‘to this' she waves her arm signalling the carnage all around.

Outro_38.speaker: Player
Outro_38.text: I had to kill her... something compelled me from within.

Outro_20.speaker: Player
Outro_20.text: To this glorious soil of carnage! Isobel I ripped, and now look at what I reaped!

Outro_43.speaker: Player
Outro_43.text: I'm truly sorry for your loss.

Outro_27.speaker: Jaheira
Outro_27.text: But you live. A single green leaf holding fast on a tree ravaged by winter.

Outro_25.speaker: Player
Outro_25.text: More leaves than one. You're still alive as well.

Outro_13.speaker: Jaheira
Outro_13.text: Yes. I adorn the crown of the Oak Father still, and as long as I do, there's an ever so slim chance I could make it back to Baldur's Gate.

Outro_47.speaker: Jaheira
Outro_47.text: If I can warn the dukes an army of Absolutists is on the march, perhaps the city still stands a fighting chance.

Outro_12.speaker: Player
Outro_12.text: So where do we go from here?

Outro_14.speaker: Jaheira
Outro_14.text: Frankly I don't see another option than to make a desperate dash back to Baldur's Gate.

Outro_52.speaker: Player
Outro_52.text: We can weep and moan our hearts out later. Right now, we need to get out of here.

Outro_41.speaker: Jaheira
Outro_41.text: There's no way forward, only the almost hopeless retreat back to Baldur's Gate.

Outro_6.speaker: Player
Outro_6.text: Get a grip. This isn't over yet.

Outro_8.speaker: Jaheira
Outro_8.text: After such carnage you'd persist? Sometimes there's folly in such courage.

Outro_4.speaker: Player
Outro_4.text: Then by all means I'm a fool. But I'm not giving up.

Outro_5.speaker: Jaheira
Outro_5.text: Perhaps it's right that you're not. You're twice blessed after all: by Isobel and by your artefact. But as for myself, I don't see another option than to make a desperate dash back to Baldur's Gate.

Outro_22.speaker: Jaheira
Outro_22.text: Chances are slim I'd survive the journey back, but if I can warn the dukes an army of Absolutists is on the march, perhaps the city still stands a fighting chance.

Outro_53.speaker: Player
Outro_53.text: The fight is here, with Ketheric. Join my camp and when the time comes we'll face him together.

Outro_24.speaker: Jaheira
Outro_24.text: That proud determination of yours should shame me, but it heartens me instead. Pull aside the curtain of years and I can see myself echoing your resolve.

Outro_28.speaker: Jaheira
Outro_28.text: Very well, I'll join you, and when Ketheric falls, I'll be there - for us, for them, and for the ones we love back home.
Outro_28.context: CinematicNodeContext: On 'them' she gestures to the fallen again.

Outro_46.speaker: Player
Outro_46.text: In that case, good luck and godsspeed.

Outro_44.speaker: Jaheira
Outro_44.text: Thank you, truly. May you succeed where I have failed. You are the stuff of legends now. Pray that I live to tell your tale.

Outro_42.speaker: Player
Outro_42.text: You were doomed to fail from the start. This was bound to happen.

Outro_3.speaker: Jaheira
Outro_3.text: As long as there was light... But no longer.

Outro_40.speaker: Player
Outro_40.text: I am the damn light. Nothing can extinguish me.

Outro_32.speaker: Jaheira
Outro_32.text: I'm tempted to take your word for it. You're twice blessed after all: by Isobel and by your artefact. But as for myself, I don't see another option than to make a desperate dash back to Baldur's Gate.

Outro_0.speaker: Player
Outro_0.text: You'll be happy to hear my mission was a success. I came to kidnap Isobel, and so I did.

Outro_29.speaker: Jaheira
Outro_29.text: You... It was you after all? All along... How could I have missed such madness?

Outro_30.speaker: Jaheira
Outro_30.text: These many dead are yours. You will lie and rot among them.

Outro_15.context: InternalNodeContext: Player and Jaheira gather in Haven yard after combat. This node is where Jaheira knows player caused the Shadow Siege by killing/kidnapping Isobel and caused everyone to die in Haven.

Outro_39.speaker: Jaheira
Outro_39.text: It is abominable that you still live - you who has cost us so much. The murderer of light.
Outro_39.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) Jaheira eyes us with hatred. She’s breathing heavily, exhausted by combat against the shadow creatures. She looks down - but she’s not out.NodeContext: Shes exhausted from combat, but her hatred of us keeps her standing.

Outro_45.speaker: Jaheira
Outro_45.text: These dead need not be buried. Beneath this canopy of darkness, all is one yard of restless graves.

Outro_33.speaker: Jaheira
Outro_33.text: You will lie and rot among them.
Outro_33.context: NodeContext: Fiery, spat at the player

Outro_18.speaker: Player
Outro_18.text: I am fangs and teeth. I am bloodlust made flesh. You wouldn't understand.

Outro_48.speaker: Jaheira
Outro_48.text: Oh, but I do. I travelled with one such as you once. I didn't see it at first, but I do now: the galaxy of malice in your eyes.

Outro_35.speaker: Jaheira
Outro_35.text: Your blood is beyond hope of redemption. May it water these accursed grounds and grow the sickly roses that will mark your grave.

Outro_17.speaker: Player
Outro_17.text: No, Jaheira. You mistake your own fate for mine.

Outro_34.speaker: Jaheira
Outro_34.text: You bluff, I call. Let's see who has the upper hand.

Outro_26.speaker: Player
Outro_26.text: You're weak; exhausted. Walk away while you still can.

Outro_51.speaker: Jaheira
Outro_51.text: I should end you, but my strength fails me. Perhaps I can outrun the shadows - even as I pray they will creep into the very marrow of your bones.

Outro_21.speaker: Jaheira
Outro_21.text: Whether the worm in your skull overwhelms you or not, your end will be a vile one.

Outro_1.speaker: Jaheira
Outro_1.text: No. To let you live would be beyond cowardice. You sowed these many dead - now I will do the reaping.

Outro_16.speaker: Jaheira
Outro_16.text: No. To let you live would be beyond cowardice. You sowed these many dead indeed, but now I will do the reaping.

Intro_98.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jaheira and player spot something overhead-- a ghoul flying with a KO Isobel in his arms from the balcony toward Moonrise.

Intro_24.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Protective barrier starts flickering and falling. Pockets of Shadow Blight rise around, suffocating the light.|InternalNodeContext: Isobel was defeated after Marcus summoned the Ghouls, but before they were all killed. Marcus is alive to abduct her.

Intro_41.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Screams sound from inside the inn as the area is consumed by darkness as the inside goes dark. Player and Jaheira run out of front doors of inn.

Intro_45.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jaheira and player spot something overhead-- Marcus flying with a KO Isobel in his arms from the balcony toward Moonrise.

Intro_85.speaker: Karlach
Intro_85.text: What were you thinking?! What are we doing here?
Intro_85.context: NodeContext: Player just committed an evil act (allowing Isobel to be kidnapped) and Karlach is aghast.

Intro_62.speaker: Wyll
Intro_62.text: Shit. This was your doing. All of it.
Intro_62.context: NodeContext: Player just committed an evil act (allowing Isobel to be kidnapped) and Wyll is aghast.

Intro_46.speaker: Gale
Intro_46.text: Behold, the consequences of your actions.

Intro_115.speaker: Jaheira
Intro_115.text: Isobel. No! What in the Nine Hells happened?!
Intro_115.context: CinematicNodeContext: Running into position after seeing the barrier shimmer and breakNodeContext: Subtext is that Isobel being captured spells death and doom for all remaining in the inn. Pause between 'Isobel, no!' and 'What the hells...' Jaheira is comprehending wtf happened and turns to the player for an explanation.

Intro_72.speaker: Player
Intro_72.text: She was my sacrifice. It was a delight.

Intro_56.speaker: Jaheira
Intro_56.text: You wretch! To think you had my trust. If this be my last act, let it be in service of strangling the life out of you.

Intro_105.speaker: Player
Intro_105.text: Marcus was a True Soul. He said he was taking Isobel to Ketheric Thorm.

Intro_1.speaker: Player
Intro_1.text: Marcus was a True Soul. He said he was taking Isobel to Ketheric Thorm, but he died in the attempt. One of his ghouls grabbed her instead.

Intro_43.speaker: Jaheira
Intro_43.text: And you had no idea? After Marcus vouched for you at the gate, he didn't confide in you?

Intro_65.speaker: Player
Intro_65.text: He did, but I decided to handle him myself.

Intro_86.speaker: Jaheira
Intro_86.text: You don't get to decide. Not here. Not while I'm responsible for the lives of the people at this inn.
Intro_86.context: NodeContext: Furious. The player made a bad call and now everyone is screwed. Not shouting; cold fury.

Intro_0.speaker: Player
Intro_0.text: He didn't - I had no idea.

Intro_16.speaker: Jaheira
Intro_16.text: I suppose I have no choice but to believe you.

Intro_103.speaker: Jaheira
Intro_103.text: Isobel is gone. Soon the shadows will wash us all away.

Intro_7.speaker: Jaheira
Intro_7.text: Listen closely, for there's very little time. Even if Last Light falls, you must destroy the cult of the Absolute.
Intro_7.context: NodeContext: desperate - recounting the story quickly and with urgency

Intro_84.speaker: Jaheira
Intro_84.text: Their leader is a man called Ketheric Thorm. He resides in Moonrise Towers, and we've found him to be impervious to the blade, and to magic to boot.

Intro_11.speaker: Jaheira
Intro_11.text: Even so, you must find him and you must kill him.

Intro_8.speaker: Jaheira
Intro_8.text: As impossible as that task sounds, there must be a way to break the spell that makes him invincible. There are secrets in this ancient waste, hidden from...
Intro_8.context: NodeContext: she's interrupted at the end

Intro_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Jaheria directs attention to something outside|

Intro_112.context: CinematicNodeContext: |In front of the inn, a generic Harper is the first to transform: He appears to suffocate, then falls, gasping and screaming; he contorts (strained exhalation as the life is squeezed out of him), and rises again covered in Shadow Blight.|

Intro_91.speaker: Jaheira
Intro_91.text: So it begins. So it will end.

Intro_70.speaker: Jaheira
Intro_70.text: It's happening. They'll all be taken by the shadows. Only by the grace of Isobel's spell will we be spared the same fate.

Intro_10.speaker: Jaheira
Intro_10.text: It's happening. They'll all be taken by the shadows.

Intro_54.speaker: Jaheira
Intro_54.text: For a little while longer, you and I are destined to fight side by side, but if the shades don't take you, I have the next claim on your head.

Intro_110.speaker: Jaheira
Intro_110.text: We cannot hesitate. Not even for those we knew - those we cared for. They're no longer who they were.

Intro_60.speaker: Jaheira
Intro_60.text: Steel your hearts and steady your hands. To battle!

Intro_57.speaker: Jaheira
Intro_57.text: Listen closely, for there's very little time. Even if Last Light falls, your mission does not change: you must find Ketheric Thorm and you must kill him.

Intro_59.speaker: Jaheira
Intro_59.context: NodeContext: Cold disdain. She's about to fight you.

Intro_92.speaker: Jaheira
Intro_92.text: I gave you my trust too easily, but with the same ease I swear I'll strike you down.
Intro_92.context: NodeContext: To her troops, elevated. About to start combat.

Intro_79.speaker: Jaheira
Intro_79.context: NodeContext: she's interrupted at the end

Intro_55.speaker: Player
Intro_55.text: There's no time for this. We have a shadow curse to deal with.

Intro_29.speaker: Jaheira
Intro_29.text: You're right. There's no stopping it now.

Intro_37.speaker: Jaheira
Intro_37.text: In this moment, you are the greater threat.

Intro_33.speaker: Player
Intro_33.text: He did. I thought it'd be fun to see what he had planned for you.

Intro_66.speaker: Jaheira
Intro_66.text: Blackguard! You're viler than the worm that's consuming you.
Intro_66.context: NodeContext: Fury; the player has admitted to being a traitor

Intro_51.speaker: Jaheira
Intro_51.text: Gods spare us. Ketheric was planning our demise all along.

Intro_95.speaker: Player
Intro_95.text: I helped Marcus kidnap Isobel. And now I'm going to watch the shadows consume you.

Intro_111.speaker: Player
Intro_111.text: I was curious to see what you would do without her.

Intro_50.speaker: Player
Intro_50.text: The Absolute's forces happened. Now we know what we're up against.

Intro_3.speaker: Jaheira
Intro_3.text: I see little more than a cowardly deception at play.

Intro_64.speaker: Karlach
Intro_64.text: What were you thinking?! What are we doing here?
Intro_64.context: NodeContext: Player just committed an evil act (allowing Isobel to be kidnapped) and Karlach is aghast.

Intro_26.speaker: Wyll
Intro_26.text: Shit. This was your doing. All of it.

Intro_80.speaker: Jaheira
Intro_80.text: Isobel! No! What in the Nine Hells happened?

Intro_96.speaker: Player
Intro_96.text: It looks like some kind of terrible accident.

Intro_67.speaker: Player
Intro_67.text: It looks like one of our enemies got hold of her.

Intro_13.speaker: Jaheira
Intro_13.text: I don't see how she... Unless some cultist sneaked in, but gods, we'll be overrun!
Intro_13.context: NodeContext: Frustration, trying to make sense of this, but there's no time.

Intro_28.speaker: Player
Intro_28.text: There's no time for this, Jaheira; without Isobel, the shadows will overrun this place.

Intro_18.speaker: Jaheira
Intro_18.text: Liar! It was you who killed her.

Intro_31.speaker: Player
Intro_31.text: Isobel and I got into a little spat.

Intro_27.speaker: Jaheira
Intro_27.context: NodeContext: Jaheira's eyes harden. the player just admitted to killing Isobel

Intro_48.speaker: Jaheira
Intro_48.text: I can't believe I didn't see you for what you are. A murderer. You killed her, and in doing so you've spelled our doom.

Intro_23.speaker: Gale
Intro_23.text: Behold, the consequences of your actions.

Intro_101.context: InternalNodeContext: Outside shot, player runs outside.

Intro_90.speaker: Jaheira
Intro_90.text: Do you understand what you've done? Without Isobel, everyone in this inn is as good as dead!

Intro_109.speaker: Jaheira
Intro_109.text: I trusted you. Silvanus forgive me, I let you in.
